meanings.definition: In a manner showing lack of skill or knowledge.
meanings.sent1: She attempted the task inexpertly, making many mistakes.
meanings.sent2: He painted the wall inexpertly, leaving streaks of paint everywhere.
meanings.sent3: The magician inexpertly pulled a rabbit out of his hat, but it turned out to be a stuffed toy.
meanings.sent4: The new chef chopped the vegetables inexpertly, like a child playing with a toy knife.
meanings.sent5: The student played the piano inexpertly, hitting all the wrong keys.

meanings.sent1: The inexpertly made cake was burnt on the outside and raw on the inside.
meanings.sent2: She gave an inexpertly prepared presentation, stumbling over her words.
meanings.sent3: The inexpertly built sandcastle collapsed as soon as the tide came in.
meanings.sent4: His inexpertly tied knot came undone, causing the package to fall open.
meanings.sent5: The inexpertly drawn portrait barely resembled the subject, with disproportionate features.
